abstracts.cdata!:
The Financial Sector Development Project
            (FSDP) is rated as unsatisfactory, sustainability as likely,
            institutional development impact as modest, Bank performance
            as satisfactory, and borrower performance as unsatisfactory.
            The key lessons learned include: It is very difficult to
            bring about improvements in bank performance on a
            sustainable basis without genuine efforts to strengthen
            corporate governance to instill a commercial culture in
            banks. Clarity of objectives is an essential prerequisite of
            project design. The objectives and design of Bank projects
            should strive to reflect political economy constraints and
            challenges. The objectives and design of Bank projects
            should strive to reflect political economy constraints and
            challenges. As far as possible, different components of a
            project should be interconnected with a common objective. In
            projects that involve supporting selected entities,
            enterprises, banks, etc., those entities should be carefully
            selected on the basis of clear and transparent criteria.
            Projects should specify monitoring standards and
            quantifiable benchmarks against which the achievement of the
            various project development objectives may be assessed.
